stream_context.summary: Kaze integrates Biobak’s newly finished Course 1 rework, fixes draw-order bugs, benchmarks performance, and begins importing revamped actors while preparing a one-level demo.

development_findings.summary: Imported Biobak’s full geometry rework of Course 1 and began reorganising draw layers; most static pieces were moved to “layout 0” to improve render order and RDP cost.
development_findings.quote: Today we are working on the rework of Course 1 that Biobak just finished.

development_findings.summary: Planned a public demo that will contain only the reworked Course 1 once visuals, actors and collision are complete.
development_findings.quote: The demo will just be one stage, nothing more.

development_findings.summary: Implemented a new render-order strategy: duplicate materials or place geometry on layer 0 when it never needs to draw over anything; resorted meshes in Blender by distance & material.
Benchmarking showed ~73 % CPU idle on real N64; switching to the X3 build (larger vertex buffer) raised frame-rate to roughly 49–60 FPS with Course 1 fully loaded.
development_findings.quote: In a 33.3 ms frame, we have 24.3 idle time. The CPU is not working two thirds of the time.

development_findings.summary: Added a custom physics bone that gives Mario’s nose soft-body ‘jiggle’; uses stored acceleration and pendulum maths, written for minimal performance cost.
development_findings.quote: It is a genuine physics bone I added to Mario… this is hyper-optimised; if you make one change it’s just going to crash.

development_findings.summary: Created a rotating lens-flare sun that tracks camera yaw/pitch by manipulating UVs rather than rotating geometry, keeping it cheap on the RDP.
development_findings.quote: You look up and you get blinded… this should have happened when you look at the wing cap entrance.

development_findings.summary: Fixed a nasty stripe artefact by disabling “coverage × alpha” in the material; RDP time dropped slightly after the change.
ROM has grown to 63 MB; Kaze insists on staying below the 64 MB historical limit to preserve ‘true’ N64 authenticity even though larger ROMs run on hardware.
development_findings.quote: If you go over 64 MB, are you really still making an N64 game? It just feels like cheating to me.

development_findings.summary: Began importing updated actors: Yoshi Egg (coin-star spawner), Bouncy Flower, Goomba King, Spiked Goomba, Bunny Goomba, Paragoomba, Rabbits, Windmill Propeller; most models now use fewer materials and triangles.
Discovered billboard-bone quirks causing inverted scaling/rotation on new Goomba models; will re-rig bones and give correct shadows off-stream.
Plans to modify Goomba King fight so his movement feels less clunky and animate castle doors that open only when he exits.
Badub delivered biome-specific music variants (e.g., Course 14 pyramids); engine will fade channels in/out depending on sub-area.
development_findings.quote: This song has versions for every biome… it will smoothly fade mini-channels in and out.

context_findings.summary: Kaze streams mainly for live feedback, not as a professional content creator; applies ‘minimum effort’ to streaming logistics.
context_findings.quote: I stream because I want to stream and because I like having people give me feedback… I’m not trying to be a professional streamer.

context_findings.summary: Modding income from YouTube/Patreon is ‘not even half’ of his normal job salary, so the project remains a passion side-gig.
context_findings.quote: Modding makes me some amount of money… but it’s not even half of what my normal job makes.

context_findings.summary: Considers a second-channel video series analysing why each course is worth playing, hoping community comments will spark design insights.
context_findings.quote: I might realise important things, maybe people can give me important insights once they hear my thought processes.

context_findings.summary: Expresses pride in pushing N64 visuals (‘prettiest N64 game’) yet staying within period-correct limits; sees exceeding 64 MB as cheating.
Shows typical emotional roller-coaster: excitement over performance wins (‘hell yeah’) and frustration with rendering bugs or actor glitches.
Floats branding idea of ‘I hate video games, so I’m making the first good one,’ reflecting his contrarian humour and high standards.

biobak.summary: Delivered complete Course 1 visual overhaul, including distant-background request and sun-flare spin idea.
biobak.quote: One change Biobak requested was… an infinitely far background here.

biobak.summary: Re-modelled several actors (Goomba King, Spiked Goomba, Paragoomba, Bunny Goomba, Rabbits, Bouncy Flower) with fewer materials, better UVs, and cosmetic upgrades such as shoe shine.
biobak.quote: Saved three materials and helm is half the size… I had so much room left I gave him soles and shine to his shoes.

badub.summary: Composed new multi-biome tracks (e.g., grassland, pyramid) with smooth channel-fade system planned for engine.
badub.quote: This song has versions for every biome.

key_stories.title: Bouncy Nose Physics
key_stories.summary: Kaze wanted a playful detail and coded a soft-body simulation for Mario’s nose via a dedicated physics bone.
key_stories.challenge: Add dynamic movement without tanking performance.
key_stories.process: Stored previous nose position, calculated acceleration, applied pendulum maths each frame; hyper-optimised C code.
key_stories.outcome: Fully functional, cheap nose jiggle displayed on stream.
key_stories.key_quote: Do you see it? It’s actual rigid body physics, or soft body physics, I don’t know how you call it.

key_stories.title: Layer 0 Render-Order Fix
key_stories.summary: Integrating Course 1 rework caused severe draw-order glitches; Kaze re-layered geometry and fixed material settings.
key_stories.challenge: Geometry and trees rendered over/under incorrectly due to N64 microcode limitations.
key_stories.process: Moved eligible meshes to layout 0, duplicated materials where necessary, resorted faces, disabled coverage-alpha bug.
key_stories.outcome: Visuals stabilised and RDP time dropped; game holds ~50–60 FPS on console.
key_stories.key_quote: We should make as much as possible of this layout 0.

key_stories.title: Authenticity vs. Size
key_stories.summary: Project ROM nears 64 MB; Kaze debates whether exceeding that boundary undermines the goal of making a ‘real’ N64 game.
key_stories.challenge: Balancing asset growth with historical hardware limits.
key_stories.process: Checked current size (63 MB), noted theoretical 254 MB cap, but declared >64 MB ‘lame’.
key_stories.outcome: Team will try to stay under 64 MB, influencing future optimisation and asset decisions.
key_stories.key_quote: If you go over 64 MB, are you really still making an N64 game? It just feels like cheating to me.
